greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Primes of the form 12k+1 generated recursively. Initial prime is 13. General term is a(n)=Min {p is prime; p divides Q^4-Q^2+1}, where Q is the product of previous terms in the sequence.
comment: All prime divisors of Q^4 - Q^2 + 1 are congruent to 1 modulo 12.
reference: K. Ireland and M. Rosen, A Classical Introduction to Modern Number Theory, Springer-Verlag, NY, Second Edition (1990), p. 63.
link: N. Hobson, Home page (listed in lieu of email address)
results.author: Nick Hobson, Nov 18 2006
